From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin investīre. Doublet of envestir.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [im.bəsˈti]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [iɱ.vəsˈti]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [iɱ.vesˈtiɾ]

Verb

[edit]

investir (first-person singular present investeixo, first-person singular preterite investí, past participle investit)

  1. to invest (to ceremonially install someone in some office)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of investir (third conjugation, with -eix-)
infinitive investir
gerund investint
past participle masculine feminine
singular investit investida
plural investits investides
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present investeixo investeixes investeix investim investiu investeixen
imperfect investia investies investia investíem investíeu investien
future investiré investiràs investirà investirem investireu investiran
preterite investí investires investí investírem investíreu investiren
conditional investiria investiries investiria investiríem investiríeu investirien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present investeixi investeixis investeixi investim investiu investeixin
imperfect investís investissis investís investíssim investíssiu investissin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — investeix investeixi investim investiu investeixin
negative (no) — no investeixis no investeixi no investim no investiu no investeixin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • investiment

Related terms

[edit]
  • investidura
  • vestir

Further reading

[edit]
  • “investir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “investir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “investir” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “investir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin investīre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ɛ̃.vɛs.tiʁ/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Switzerland (Valais)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Toulouse)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

investir

  1. to invest
  2. to lay siege to, to besiege
  3. to install into office, to vest, to give formal authority to

Conjugation

[edit]

This is a regular verb of the second conjugation, like finir, choisir, and most other verbs with infinitives ending in -ir. One salient feature of this conjugation is the repeated appearance of the infix -iss-.

Conjugation of investir (see also Appendix:French verbs)
infinitive simple investir
compound avoir + past participle
present participle or gerund1 simple investissant

past participle investi

1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Related terms

[edit]
  • investissement

Further reading

[edit]
  • “investir”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • vitrines

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin investiō, investīre.

Verb

[edit]

investir (first-person singular present invisto, third-person singular present inviste, first-person singular preterite investín, past participle investido)
investir (first-person singular present invisto, third-person singular present investe, first-person singular preterite investim or investi, past participle investido, reintegrationist norm)

  1. to invest (commit money or effort)
  2. to invest (ceremonially install someone in some office)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of investir (e becomes i when stressed)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person

[edit]

  • investimento
  • vestir

[edit]

  • “investir”, in Dicionário Estraviz de galego (in Galician), 2014–2025

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin investīre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.vesˈt͡ʃi(ʁ)/ [ĩ.vesˈt͡ʃi(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.vesˈt͡ʃi(ʁ)/ [ĩ.vesˈt͡ʃi(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /ĩ.vesˈt͡ʃi(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /ĩ.veʃˈt͡ʃi(ʁ)/ [ĩ.veʃˈt͡ʃi(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /ĩ.vesˈt͡ʃi(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ĩ.vɨʃˈtiɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ĩ.vɨʃˈtiɾ/
    • (Northern Portugal) IPA(key): /ĩ.bɨʃˈtiɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ĩ.vɨʃˈti.ɾi/

  • Homophone: investi (Brazil)

Verb

[edit]

investir (first-person singular present invisto, third-person singular present investe, first-person singular preterite investi, past participle investido)

  1. to invest (commit money or effort)
    Synonyms: empatar, embaraçar
  2. to charge (move forward quickly and forcefully, particularly in combat)
    Synonyms: atacar, acometer, arremeter
  3. to invest (ceremonially install someone in some office)
    Synonyms: nomear, empossar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of investir (i-e alternation in present singular) (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal investir
Personal investir investires investir investirmos investirdes investirem
Gerund
investindo
Past participle
Masculine investido investidos
Feminine investida investidas
Indicative
Present invisto investes investe investimos investis investem
Imperfect investia investias investia investíamos investíeis investiam
Preterite investi investiste investiu investimos investistes investiram
Pluperfect investira investiras investira investíramos investíreis investiram
Future investirei investirás investirá investiremos investireis investirão
Conditional investiria investirias investiria investiríamos investiríeis investiriam
Subjunctive
Present invista invistas invista invistamos invistais invistam
Imperfect investisse investisses investisse investíssemos investísseis investissem
Future investir investires investir investirmos investirdes investirem
Imperative
Affirmative investe invista invistamos investi invistam
Negative (não) não invistas não invista não invistamos não invistais não invistam

Related terms

[edit]
  • investida
  • investido
  • investidor
  • investidura
  • investimento
  • vestir

Spanish

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • envestir

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin investīre. Doublet of embestir.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /imbesˈtiɾ/ [ĩm.besˈt̪iɾ]
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: in‧ves‧tir

Verb

[edit]

investir (first-person singular present invisto, first-person singular preterite investí, past participle investido)

  1. (transitive) to invest (to ceremonially install someone in some office)
    • 2015 September 14, “Baños acusa a Iglesias de querer dividir a los catalanes por su origen”, in El País‎[1]:
      El diputado de la CUP David Fernández añadió que “no hay un sólo documento donde esté previsto investir a Mas. No le haremos el juego.
      (please add an English translation of this quotation)
  2. (considered incorrect) to invest (to commit money or effort)
    Synonym: invertir

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of investir (e-i alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund invistiendo

singular investido investida
plural investidos investidas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
